projects.title: Halifax Canoe and Kayak
projects.description: Website for booking canoe and kayak adventures. Skills demonstrated in the full-stack developement and basics of cloud-computing using AWS Cloud. A project for Digital Nova Scotia - Skills for Hire program.
details: Created the website as a project for booking the adventure for Canoe and Kayaking from the available trips
Designed the responsive UI using HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, and jQuery from the wireframe design
Developed the backend and validated the form submitted on the server side using PHP
Handled the version control using Git and GitHub for all 3-phases of the project
Launched on the AWS as Iaas, using EC2, configured LAMP Stack and RDS for the MySQL relational database
Integrated multiple Docker-container seamlessly using docker-compose, deployed the project on the DockerHub

projects.title: Nish-Foody
projects.description: A website for food ordering and selling. Skills demonstrated as a full-stack developer and documentarian for this final project spanning over 3 months.
details: Developed a fully-functional website for food ordering/selling for the people of Antigonish
Worked as a full-stack developer in SDLC as a 5-member team to create the website as the final year project
Surveyed people from different backgrounds for the requirement analysis; and spearheaded the documentation
Designed the menu page using HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap for the UI and the cart for orders using JS/jQuery
Adopted the Django framework serving REST API that was connected to the PostgreSQL database
Followed the Agile methodology with tools like JIRA and Confluence pages for the documentation

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: My personal website to demonstrate my skills to the world. This project demonstrates my skill as front-end developer for which I used ReactJS and ChakraUI, and hosted on Netlify.
details: Leveraged vite tool to create the app for the faster build time for ReactJS app
Demonstrated expertise in component library like ChakraUI to create reusable modular components
Utilized react hooks like useState, useEffect, useRef, useCallback effectively when needed
Created database on GCP's firebase (Backend-as-a-Service) and used Storaage for files
Containerized the app using Docker, and pushed the docker image on DockerHub
Created mini-projects to experiment with features like fetching data, creating carousel, learn different hooks, dark-mode, etc.
Hosted the app on the Netlify platform which pulls latest image from the Github's master-branch

projects.title: Hotel Management System
projects.description: The relational database for Hotel Management System for booking/reserving the room. The project was developed in 4-phases using waterfall methodology and deployed on the StFX University's Oracle server setup by the professor.
details: Developed the relational database as a 4-member team for the Hotel Management
Actively participated in creating the ERD diagram, designing and then normalizing the database
Performed CRUD operations maintaining the constraints placed on the 4/15 tables using SQL
Prepared some python scripts to generate and load a large amount of data automatically to the database
Prepared meaningful Views and useful queries on the database by applying joins on the tables
Deployed the relational database on the university's Oracle Server hosted by the professor

projects.title: Crime Analysis
projects.description: A comprehensive study of factors influencing crime in the USA over three decades (1980s, 1990s, 2000s). Increase in crime-rate in the recent times (like mass shooting) was the purpose behind choosing this project
details: Generated R-markdown report presenting our work from the data collection to our findings on the factors affecting crime-rate
Data Collection: The Analysis of the USA data obtained from the Kaggle and FBI crime data explorer
Data Wrangling: Split and merged datasets performing ETL to convert the raw data into valuable information
Visualization: Generated high-quality and meaningful plots by executing functions from the ggplot2 library
Exploratory Data Analysis: To find a correlation between Crime rate and two factors: Unemployment & Education
Modeling: To understand how different types of crime are evolving over the decades in the USA
Summurized how unemployment-rate and crime-rate evolved over the three decades
Prepared residual-plots demonstrating distribution of errors to conclude the robustness of our models

projects.title: Sentiment Analysis
projects.description: The tweets dataset having 3000+ tweets were investigated to determined if tweets are positive, negative or neutral. Demonstrated  the expertise in preprocessing the English-language sentences (tweets)
details: Removed hyperlinks, punctuations, whitespaces, hashtags, mentiones, RT, emojis, etc using RegEx and other methods
Removed stopwords using NLTK & applied lemmatization to convert cleaned tweets to meaningful words for the anaylsis purpose
Determined the polarity of cleaned tweets using TextBlob library; based on results evaluated the sentiment of each tweet
Visulized the positive, negative or neutral sentiments of over 3000 tweets using pie-chart
Determined top 10 popular words for each sentiment using scikit-learn by eliminating common words in the process
Presented the popular words for each sentiment using wordcloud

projects.title: Food-Order Analysis
projects.description: The analysis of New York Restaurants. First experience of using google-colab platform for the analysis purpose. Transformed and visualized the data for different scenarios using Python programming language.
details: Checked the number of restaurants for each cuisine type & visualized the result using appropreate plot
Visualized the top 10 most popular restaurants for each cusine type and highlighted top 3 restaurants
Investigated proportation of review of the given restaurant (Shake Shack) and demonstrated the findings using appropriate plots
Determined the correlation between ratings and food preparation time using the r-value (person correlation cofficient)
Created various plots like pie-chart, bar-chart, box-plot using libraries like matplotlib, seaborn and plotly

projects.title: Multi-Class Image Classification
projects.description: A deep learning on the Intel Image Classification dataset accquired from Kaggle. Demontrated skills in deep learning using Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for the dataset to achieve about 80% accuray for the multi-class (6 classes) classification on the test data.
details: Proprocessed the images data acquired from Kaggle using scikit-learn, numpy, and panda according to the requirement
Utilized Keras to load data for the CNN which was based on LeNet with minor improvements to start the training
Achieved about 64% accuracy on the training data and about 31% accuracy on testing data with 1 epoch with this first model
For the next traning I added some feature maps at the dense layer before fully-connected layer to improve the model which gave me about 84% accuracy on the traning data for 5 epoches

To improve the model, experimented by converting the images to grayscale but it resulted in some erros regarding reshaping which was countered by adding rescaling layer (ideadlly solution was to do data-augmentation).
The above model after dropping some layers in between to provent overfitting improved the traning accuracy up to about 94%, and testing accuracy reached to 76% for 10 epoches
Since my GPU was not powerful enough, I didn't have capability to experiment much with large number of epoches, so what I though the best model is up to that point I trained it through 100 epoches
Added few Conv2D layers, and some batch normalization resulted in around 99% accuracy on traning data and 80% accuracy on the testing data

Experiments with different number of epoches, I concluded that increasing ephoces beyond a number doesn't necessarily improve the accuray, but performing cross validation does, and the ideal number of epoches for my model is 30
Plotted the results for different number of epoches with the model used for that particular training/testing
Craeted a table to show all the models and their perforamce to compare the models that I improved from basic LeNet to the best model I achived
Summarized my project and the thoughts techniques that can be used to improve the model in the future

projects.title: Deep Learning on MNIST Dataset
projects.description: The cross-discipline competition between MACS, Bacher of Computer Science and PBDAI having total of 80+ students taking Machine Learnign Course at StFX. The MNIST dataset was given to us and the task was to get the least errors on the test data for which we were not given any labels.
details: Achieved 2nd rank in the competition which was a big achievement for me; having no prior Data Science experience as I was learning that pre-requisite course in the parallel during the same term
Improved LeNet of Yann LeCun for this particular tasks by adding different layers to improve accuracy of the model
Conv2D layer to generate 32 feature maps, with 5x5 kernel, with unit stride and relu activation with bias
Normalization layers to stabilize the images, and converge faster
Pooling layer to extract the best feature of some regions to enhaced learning
Dropping few layers in-between to mitigate over-fitting by dropping connection and learn the patterns instead of memorizing
Dense layer to get fully-connected neural network layer, and Softmax layer with 10 units because this was a 10-class classification
Utilized all the layers above and using Stratified-Shffle-Split technique on the traning data to perform traning, testing and improve accuracy over 30 epochs
Generated error data from my internal training/testing, and my prediction on the test data to submit for the competition.

projects.title: Image Reconstruction
projects.description: The evolutionary computation project that uses the genetic algorithm based on the survival of the fittest. This project demonstrate the use of the GA that is used to generate high quality solutions to optimization and research problems.
details: Demonstrated the image reconstruction using the Genetic Algorithm based on the Darwin's theory of natural selection
Given the input image, using PyGAD and other supporting library execute the GA
Create the initial population and evalute the fiteness of each chromosome
Select the fittest choromosome for the next generation, and perform recombination (crossover) which is equivalent to inherit genes from both parents
Peform the mutation that is equivalent of child having their own characteristics different from the parents
The new generation will be added to the population for the next iteration, and repeat the process until the desired criteria is achieved
The crossover generates the new child, and mutation brings the diversity in the population that is necessary to mitigatge local maxima/minima of the search space of the problem
Utilized different cross-over, and selection stratagies to achieve high quality solution in reasonable time
Documented our process and findings in the research paper format using LaTex for the project report

projects.title: Particle Swarm Optimization
projects.description: An evolutionary algorithm to sovle optimization problem that emulates the social behavior of birds looking for food. This algorithm is a special one as it doens't need a problem to be differential unlike other classical optimization techniques
details: Ther idea is to improve the candidate solution against the fitness function iteratively
Each particle has in the swarm (group) has a position, velocity vector and fitness value and their best position and fiteness values are recorded
By communication the particles know the global best position and global best value of the swarm

The parameters of the algorithms are number of dimensions, lower and upper bound. The hyper-parameters are number of particles, max iterations, inertia component, congition of the particle component (local), and social influence of swarm component (global)
Optimized several functions like Sphere, Beale, Booth, Levi, etc. and generated the plots of the cost  vs iteration for each and particles' movements
Created a report of my work and findings in a research paper like format using LaTeX

projects.title: Minesweeper
projects.description: My version of the classic Minesweeper game to demontrate Object Oriented Programming skills in python langague using PyGame library
details: Demonstrated the use of Pygame library by reading and understanding the documenatation to deliver the working game
Implemented the modular code using DRY principles, and effectively used defensive programming using python style guide
Recorded a project video & posted on my youtube channel explaining all features and basic explaination of the program

projects.title: Snake
projects.description: My spin on classing Snake game from the old Nokia phones.
details: This was my first attempt at programming after I decided to change my career from Mechanical Engineering to Computer Science
The first mini-project submitted for the Harvard's CS50 course using the graphical langauge Scratch
Demonstrated expertise in this programming language to implement the functionality with increasing difficulty level
Learned and implemented programming concepts like variables, conditional, loops and control structure

projects.title: 8 Puzzle Solver AI
projects.description: Implimented A* algorithm to solve the 8 Puzzle. Demonstrated expertise in the Object Oriented Programming, Data Structures and Algorithms.
details: Created the grid and moved for the classic 8 Puzzle game using Object Oriented Programming
Implemented the A* algorithm to find the mininum number of moves to solve the game from the given initial configuration
Demonstrated DRY principles and Code modularity to extend the code for N-puzzle game
Modularized the game for the N-Puzzle given the size of grid N

certificates.title: Google IT Professional Certificate

certificateDetails.learnings: I learned about how to assemble a computer, basics of internet, overview of operation system and applications, problem-solving methodologies and soft-skills required in Information Technology field

certificateDetails.certName: The Bits and Bytes of Computer Networking
certificateDetails.learnings: In this course I learned basics of computer networking; five-layer and OSI model; standard protocols; network troubleshooting; basics of DNS and DHCP server

certificateDetails.certName: Operating Systems and You: Becoming a Power User
certificateDetails.learnings: I learned about Windows and Linux OS; file systems; install, configure, and remove software; disk partitioning; set up users, groups and permissions; background processes and management; troubleshoot the common issues regarding OS

certificateDetails.certName: System Administration and IT Infrastructure Services
certificateDetails.learnings: In this course I learned about chosing the best hardware and services for organizations; manage infrastructure servers; Active directory and OpenLDAP; how to backup and recover data; utilize system adminstration knowledge to plan and improve processes for IT environments

certificateDetails.certName: IT Security: Defense against the digital dark arts
certificateDetails.learnings: I learned basics of Cloud Computing; everything as a service; cloud storage; security principles and basics of ips/ids/firewall

During this professional program in addition to fundamental of IT support, I learned differnet domains of IT such as Computer Networking, Operating Systems, System Administration, Computer Security, etc.
I was rewarded this badge by Credly for completing the professional certification.

I joined NPower Canada's Junior IT Analyst program to get hands on traning in the IT field to enhance my area in the field of Computer Networking and Security to combined my work experience as a Technician. Apart from learning technical skills, I learned valuable soft skills and valuable tips about job search in the Canadian market in this field.

certificateDetails.learnings: Learned about web development fundamentals; back-end developement Php, NodeJS; front-end development HTML5, CSS3, Javascript (ES6), jQuery; docker; CI/CD Basics; AWS Basics

certificates.title: Programming Competitions
certificates.about: I participated in the ICPC Programming competition representing StFX University as a part of team X-abytes-1 under the guidence of the professor Dr. Milton King.

certificateDetails.learnings: We had to apply our data strucutres and alogrithm knowledge here. I learned a lot about time-management and how to work under pressure with a team brainstroming the ideas.

We had a meeting before the competition where we were introdued the protocols to follow. During this compeition we learned about teamwork, and how to overcome the difficult problems by sharing the ideas to solve a problem and iteratively make the solution efficient.

certificates.title: Harvard Certificates
certificates.about: My first ever Computer Science introductory course. I participated in the various events of Harvard's CS50 courses, and enrolled in other courses.

certificateDetails.learnings: I learned general overview of the Computer Science field and learned building blocks like basic data strucutres, algorithm, memory management, and fundamental concepts to build my career. I learned several programming languages like scratch, c, python, html, javascript, and solved challenging assignments like recovering images, spell-checker, game of fifteen using C - langauge.

I earned this certificate for participating in the puzzle day event in 2019. I was in the team with members from Belgium, Turkey, Ukraine, and Netherlands. We were colleagues in CS50 course and coordinated using Discord platform. We are rewarded the certificate for solving 9 out of 12 puzzles.

I earned this certificate 2nd year in a row for the puzzle day online event. I participated as a one-member team to challenge myself this year for the event. I was rewarded the certificate for solving 6 out of 8 puzzles.

I took the Data Science course to get familiar with the basics of the field because I was fascinated by the Machine Learning concepts that I was introduced in the MIT 6002x course. This was my first course in a specialization of this field.

certificates.title: MIT Certificates
certificates.about: After learning basic concepts of Computer Science from Harvard's CS50 course, I was recommended this course by my peers when I was looking for recommendation for Python coruses.

certificateDetails.certName: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming Using Python
certificateDetails.learnings: A deep dive in to core computer science concepts with the help of mathematics on the parts like big-oh analysis. Apart from learning technical skills, I learned time management and stress management as this was my first instructor-paced course where I had to submit assignments and complete exams by the set deadlines.

certificateDetails.certName: Introduction to Computational Thinking and Data Science
certificateDetails.learnings: This course challenged me in a whole new way, and I decided to build my career in the Data Science / Machine Learning in the future. I learned about graph data structure and related algorithms, stochastic programming and statistical thinking, Monte-Carlo simulation, various plotting libraries, and introduction to Machine Learning with KNN.
This certificate was rewarded to me for completing X series program by completing the 6001x and 6002x courses from MIT.
I leaned about basic programming concepts like data types, variables, logic, loops, control flows, functions, etc. and got familiar with various terminologies of Java langauge.
In this course I learned abotu arrays, classes & objects, inheritance, polymorphism, abstract classes, and interfaces.

During this course I learned abuot various searching and sorting algorithms like bubble sort, selection sort, merge sort, linear search, binary search, and data structures like liked list, stack, queue.

I was rewarded this certificate for completing the series of Java coruses offered by Microsoft. During the entire program I learned how to program using Java Language and terminologies related to the programming language.
